tool_description: RESTful API to models of cosmic ray induced ionising radiation in the atmosphere
name: Aviation Radiation API
title: Aviation Radiation API

api_list.name: app.api_icaro.endpoints.ICARO.ambient_dose
api_list.description:
The ambient dose equivalent, H*(10), is an operational quantity that simulates the human body by measuring the dose equivalent at a depth of 10 mm within a tissue equivalent sphere of 300 mm diameter. It is a measurable quantity that is used to calibrate area monitors (radiation detectors) for mixed radiation fields.

Use this endpoint if you are comparing model predictions to measurements.

This API can run in two modes:

Either specify
altitude, duration
for constant altitude calculations;

Or specify
initial_altitude, cruising_altitudes, climb_times, cruising_times, descent_time, final_altitude
to calculate dose accounting for a step climb.

Note: the airport codes or coordinates (depending on which was specified), and the date in DD/MM/YYYY format, are echoed in the json response as strings.

API requests must contain a key "API-Key" in the header (see code samples).

Visit our to obtain a key with a 14 day free trial.

required_parameters.name: origin
required_parameters.description: The ICAO code or IATA code or latitude,longitude pair (in decimal degrees) of the origin airport.

required_parameters.name: destination
required_parameters.description: The ICAO code or IATA code or latitude,longitude pair (in decimal degrees) of the destination airport.

optional_parameters.name: duration
optional_parameters.description: The flight duration in hours. The minimum is 0, the maximum is 20 hrs.

optional_parameters.name: initial_altitude
optional_parameters.description: Initial altitude (in km) for a step climb. The minimum is 0 m, the maximum is 20 km.

optional_parameters.name: descent_time
optional_parameters.description: Descent time from last cruising altitude to final altitude (in hours) for a step climb.

optional_parameters.name: final_altitude
optional_parameters.description: Final altitude (in km) for a step climb.

optional_parameters.name: altitude
optional_parameters.description: Altitude (in km). The minimum is 0 m, the maximum is 20 km.

optional_parameters.name: cruising_altitudes
optional_parameters.description: Cruising altitudes (in km) for a step climb. The minimum is 0 m, the maximum is 20 km.

optional_parameters.name: cruising_times
optional_parameters.description: Cruising times at each cruising altitude (in hours) for a step climb.

optional_parameters.name: climb_times
optional_parameters.description: Climb times for each cruising altitude (in hours) for a step climb.

api_list.name: app.api_parma.endpoints.PARMA.effective_dose
api_list.description:
Effective dose is a radiation protection quantity defined by the International Commission on Radiological Protection (ICRP) and represents the stochastic health risk to the human body at low levels of radiation. It accounts for the different sensitivities of organs to ionising radiation, as well as the different effectiveness of various types of radiation.
Use this endpoint if you need to estimate radiation exposures of personnel.

required_parameters.name: particle
required_parameters.description: The particle type as a string. Specifying 'total', only used for the dose calculation, returns the dose for all particle types.

optional_parameters.name: altitude
optional_parameters.description: Altitude (in km). The minimum is 0 m, the maximum is 47 km (the upper limit of the stratosphere).

optional_parameters.name: atmospheric_depth
optional_parameters.description: Atmospheric depth from the top of the atmosphere (in units of g/cm2). The minimum is 0.913 g/cm2, the maximum is 1032.66 g/cm2. WARNING: you can specify either altitude OR atmospheric depth, not both.

api_list.name: app.api_parma.endpoints.PARMA.differential_intensity
api_list.description: The differential intensity of a particle is a directional quantity that describes the number of particles per unit area, per unit solid angle, per unit energy, and per unit time. The API leverages the functionality of PARMA to calculate differential intensity distributions with energies in units of MeV and Intensity in units of /cm2/sr/MeV/s.

required_parameters.name: angle
required_parameters.description: Direction cosine. 1.0 is in the downward direction.

required_parameters.name: particle
required_parameters.description: The particle type as a string. Specifying 'total', only used for the dose calculation, returns the dose for all particle types.

optional_parameters.name: altitude
optional_parameters.description: Altitude (in km). The minimum is 0 m, the maximum is 47 km (the upper limit of the stratosphere).

optional_parameters.name: atmospheric_depth
optional_parameters.description: Atmospheric depth from the top of the atmosphere (in units of g/cm2). The minimum is 0.913 g/cm2, the maximum is 1032.66 g/cm2. WARNING: you can specify either altitude OR atmospheric depth, not both.
